court:
HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT
respondents: Ri BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT. P.M. SANEER
outcome:
ORDER

The petitioner, 8" accused in Crime No.120/2013 of
Payangadi Police Station, Kannur, which is pending as
C.C.No.315/2013 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court,
Payyannur, seeks quashing of all further proceedings against
him. The offences charged against the petitioner and others are
under section 143, 147, 148, 341, 323, 324, 506 (i) r/w 149 IPC.
According to the petitioner, the crime happened to be charged in
relation to certain violent incidents that had taken place between
two groups of various different parties. The issues according to
the petitioner have been settled. Annexure-A2 is the affidavit
filed by the injured testifying to the above facts and stating that
he has no further complaints in the matter. It is also submitted
that the petitioner has got employment in the Central Reserve
Police Force (CRPF).

2. The Public Prosecutor reports that, there is no other case
pending against the 8" respondent.

3. Since the dispute between the injured and the petitioner

K.SURENDRA MOHAN, J.
Dated this the 17" day of April, 2015
ORDER

The petitioner, 8" accused in Crime No.120/2013 of
Payangadi Police Station, Kannur, which is pending as
C.C.No.315/2013 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court,
Payyannur, seeks quashing of all further proceedings against
him. The offences charged against the petitioner and others are
under section 143, 147, 148, 341, 323, 324, 506 (i) r/w 149 IPC.
According to the petitioner, the crime happened to be charged in
relation to certain violent incidents that had taken place between
two groups of various different parties. The issues according to
the petitioner have been settled. Annexure-A2 is the affidavit
filed by the injured testifying to the above facts and stating that
he has no further complaints in the matter. It is also submitted
that the petitioner has got employment in the Central Reserve
Police Force (CRPF).

2. The Public Prosecutor reports that, there is no other case
pending against the 8" respondent.

earl
ite te
2015/KER/17185
2
Cri.M.C.No.2206 of 2015

3. Since the dispute between the injured and the petitioner
has been settled, I am satisfied that the proceedings the against
the petitioner are required to be quashed.

In view of the above, all further proceedings in Crime
No.120/2013 of Payangadi Police Station, Kannur pending as
C.C.No.315/2013 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court,
Payyannur are quashed. It is made clear that, the proceedings
shall continue against the other accused.

K.SURENDRA MOHAN,
JUDGE.
